timeline.title: Turing Test & Foundations
timeline.details: Alan Turing publishes "Computing Machinery and Intelligence," proposing the Turing Test as a benchmark for machine intelligence and laying philosophical groundwork for AI.

timeline.title: Dartmouth Workshop - AI is Born
timeline.details: A summer workshop at Dartmouth College coins the term "Artificial Intelligence" and brings together founding researchers, establishing AI as a formal field of study.

timeline.title: First AI Winter
timeline.details: A period of reduced funding and interest in AI research due to unmet expectations, limitations in computing power, and critical government reports questioning progress.

timeline.title: Expert Systems Boom
timeline.details: AI finds commercial success with Expert Systems â€“ programs designed to mimic the decision-making ability of a human expert in narrow domains. Specialized hardware emerges.

timeline.title: Second AI Winter
timeline.details: The hype around Expert Systems fades as they prove difficult and expensive to maintain and scale. The specialized hardware market collapses, leading to another downturn in funding and interest.

timeline.title: IBM Deep Blue vs. Kasparov
timeline.details: IBM's chess-playing computer, Deep Blue, defeats world chess champion Garry Kasparov in a landmark match, showcasing the power of specialized hardware and brute-force search for specific tasks.

timeline.title: IBM Watson Wins Jeopardy!
timeline.details: IBM's Watson computer defeats human champions on the quiz show Jeopardy!, demonstrating significant advances in NLP, information retrieval, and understanding nuanced language.
timeline.quote: Paul Roetzer called this his "inflection point" for getting into AI.

timeline.title: AlexNet & Deep Learning Boom
timeline.details: AlexNet, a deep convolutional neural network, dramatically wins the ImageNet image recognition competition. This success, enabled by large datasets and GPU acceleration, triggers the modern deep learning revolution.

timeline.title: AlphaGo & "Move 37"
timeline.details: DeepMind's AlphaGo defeats world Go champion Lee Sedol 4-1. "Move 37" in game 2 becomes famous as a creative, unexpected move by the AI, highlighting the potential beyond human intuition in complex strategy.

timeline.title: ChatGPT & Generative AI Explosion
timeline.details: Following ChatGPT's viral launch in late 2022, generative AI sees explosive adoption across industries. Businesses scramble to implement AI strategies while grappling with concerns about job displacement, misinformation, and ethical usage.
timeline.quote: ChatGPT became the fastest-growing consumer application in history, reaching 100 million users in just two months.

metadata.title: The Road to AGI and Beyond
metadata.description: An interactive timeline based on insights from the Artificial Intelligence Show podcast series and AI history.
